title: Slow-motion humiliation for Starmer as he loses control of Commons
summary: – Sir Keir Starmer has a mandate and a majority, but the parallel is this: a government transparently not in control of events, shoved around humiliatingly by parliament. The extraordinary thing about Tuesday's welfare reform vote is it felt, albeit perhaps just fleetingly, like the fraught and chaotic parliamentary rows about Brexit. The astonishing thing about this row is Sir Keir Starmer has a mandate and a majority.

summary: – Photographs from the past aren't as chilling as they used to be, but there's something about the grainy black-and-white film, the stiff poses, and the haunted expressions that make these old photographs feel darker and more mysterious. title: Is Donald Trump Being Added to Mount Rushmore? Here's the Truth
summary: – The National Park Service isn't rushing to carve Donald Trump's face on Mount Rushmore, reports the New York Times. The park service says there are no viable locations left for additional carvings due to the lack of stable surfaces on the rockface. "The carved portion of Mount Rushmore has been thoroughly evaluated," the park service tells the New York Times. title: Democracy and spiritual practice
summary: – I've been writing about how we, as spiritual practitioners, might skillfully face the troubling emotions politics can give rise to. Fear (where is this all going? how bad will things get? how bad will things get?) and despair (mourning the loss of democratic norms). title: Real Madrid Sneaks Past Juventus into Club World Cup Quarterfinals
summary: – Kylian Mbappé made his Club World Cup debut Tuesday as Real Madrid beat Juventus 1-0 in Miami, Fla., thanks to Gonzalo Garcia's second-half header. Garca has started all four of the Spanish club's matches because of a gastrointestinal illness for Mbappé.

title: US, Japan, India, Australia announce critical minerals initiative
summary: – The United States, Japan, India and Australia have announced a critical minerals initiative in Washington, D.C. Tuesday, amid concerns over China's dominance in the field of minerals essential for new technologies. The group, also known as the "Quad," pledged to work towards a stable supply of minerals essential for new technologies. title: Judge says DHS can't end protected status for Haitian migrants this year
summary: – The Trump administration can't revoke temporary protected status for hundreds of thousands of Haitian migrants this fall, a federal judge has ruled. Judge Brian Cogan sided with a group of Haitian migrants who sued over the end to TPS for the Caribbean nation, saying Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem "does not have statutory or inherent authority to partially vacate a country's TPS designation." title: Apple Ordered to Pay $110.7 Million Over 3G Patent Infringement
summary: – A federal jury in Delaware has ordered Apple to pay $110.7 million in damages to Spanish technology company TOT Power Control. The jury found that Apple infringed on a key patent related to 3G wireless communication used in devices such as iPhones, iPads, and Apple Watches. title: Marko opens up about his plans for the near future
summary: Dr Helmut Marko's Red Bull contract expires at the end of the 2026 season . The 79-year-old Austrian has been Red Bull's motorsport advisor since 1989 . Marko says his focus is on getting the team back on track to win .
